intro: Dichapetalum oddonii, commonly known as the oddon's dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in open woodland and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
